title: 110_s2281
content: The Act is titled the "Thunder Bay National Marine Sanctuary and Underwater Preserve Boundary Modification Act." It includes findings and purposes for the modification. The Thunder Bay National Marine Sanctuary in Lake Huron and surrounding areas have numerous historic vessel losses, popular diving sites, and contribute to maritime heritage. These resources are at risk from human activities and must be preserved for economic viability. The Thunder Bay National Marine Sanctuary aims to expand its boundaries to include offshore waters of Presque Isle and Alcona counties in Michigan, extending to the US-Canada border. The Act also seeks to provide equal protection to underwater cultural resources in these areas. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. The term "Sanctuary" refers to the Thunder Bay National Marine Sanctuary and Underwater Preserve, while the term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Commerce. SEC. 4. SANCTUARY BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The Sanctuary boundary is adjusted to include submerged lands and underwater cultural resources lake ward of the mean high water line, starting at a point in Presque Isle County and extending to the international boundary between the United States and Canada. The boundary of the National Marine Sanctuary in Canada extends southeast to latitude 44.511111N, then west to a point at 44.511111N, 83.318483W in Alcona County. The Secretary has the authority to make minor adjustments for enforcement purposes. The area will be managed as part of the National Marine Sanctuary System. The Secretary is required to update NOAA charts. The Secretary is required to produce updated NOAA charts for the National Marine Sanctuary area, including the boundaries described in the Act. SEC. 5. Extension of regulations and management. The regulations applicable to the Sanctuary shall apply to the new geographic area unless specified otherwise. Existing certifications for prohibited activities within the Sanctuary will continue to apply. The date of the enactment of this Act will be considered the date of Sanctuary designation. The Act designates the date of Sanctuary designation. The Secretary will apply the existing management plan to the new geographic area added to the Sanctuary.
